curated_text: Symbol: FDX. Year: 2023. Period: Y2023. ReportType: K10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: United Parcel Service, Inc., USPS, FedEx Express’s, DHL, UPS, DPD, General Logistics Systems, Royal Mail, FedEx Express, Amazon.com, Canada Ground Operations of, International of FedEx Express, NMB, ALPA’s, FedEx Express Master Executive Council, the Transport Workers Union, Global Operations Control, FedEx Custom Critical, Surface Expedite, Air Expedite, White Glove Services, FedEx Ground Segment Overview, FedEx, FedEx Ground, FedEx Home Delivery, FedEx Ground Economy, PO Box, Service Guide, COVID-19, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Results of Operations and Financial Condition, FedEx Ground’s, FedEx Dataworks, DRIVE, FedEx Returns Technology, FedEx Services Segment, Customer-Driven Technology, FedEx Office, FedEx Authorized ShipCenters, Walgreens, Dollar General, Financial Statements, FedEx Freight Segment Overview FedEx Freight, LTL, FedEx Freight Priority, FedEx Freight Economy, FedEx Freight Direct, FedEx Freight, FedEx Freight Canada, intra-Canada, FedEx Ship, FedEx Web Services, LTL Select, FedEx Freight’s, YRC Worldwide Inc., YRC Regional Transportation, XPO Logistics, Inc., ABF Freight, ArcBest, SAIA, Inc., TFI International Inc., the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, FXF, FedEx Services Segment FedEx Services, FedEx Services, Customer-Driven Technology FedEx, Innovate, Shipping Management and Precision Tracking, FedEx Tracking, FedEx Virtual, SenseAware, FedEx SenseAware ID, FedEx Mobile, SMS, Android, Apple, E-Commerce Solutions FedEx, FedEx Consolidated Returns, FedEx Logistics, FedEx OnSite, FedEx Extra Hours, Picture Proof of Delivery, Adobe, Adobe Commerce’s, ShopRunner, Microsoft, FourKites, Cart.com, Nuro, Aurora Innovation, Inc., PACCAR Inc., PACCAR, Elroy Air’s, Emphasis, FedExCup, the PGA Tour, PGA Tour, St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, Official Office Services Provider, NFL, the “FedEx Air & Ground, Information Security FedEx Services. Context excerpt: Competition As described in “Item 1A. Risk Factors” of this Annual Report, the express package and freight markets are both highly competitive and sensitive to price and service, especially in periods of little or no macroeconomic growth. The ability to compete effectively depends upon price, frequency, reliability, capacity and speed of scheduled service, ability to track packages, extent of geographic coverage, innovative service offerings, and the fit within the customer’s overall supply chain. Competitors within the U.S. include other package delivery concerns, principally United Parcel Service, Inc. (“UPS”), passenger airlines offering express package services, regional delivery companies, air freight forwarders, and the USPS. FedEx Express’s principal international competitors are DHL, UPS, DPD (a subsidiary of France’s La Poste’s GeoPost), General Logistics Systems (a Royal Mail-owned parcel delivery group), foreign postal authorities, passenger airlines, air freight forwarders,
